    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Ffundamentals%2Fwhats-new-archive.md?ref=dde018218032fc49ab63f67a8e51aa79f2adc3b7",
    "patch": "@@ -21,6 +21,75 @@ For a more dynamic experience, you can now find the archive information in the M\n \n ---\n \n+## April 2025\n+\n+### Public Preview -  Conditional Access Optimization Agent in Microsoft Entra \n+\n+**Type:** New feature    \n+**Service category:** Conditional Access    \n+**Product capability:** Identity Security & Protection    \n+\n+[Conditional Access Optimization Agent in Microsoft Entra](https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/blog/microsoft-entra-blog/new-innovations-in-microsoft-entra-to-strengthen-ai-security-and-identity-protec/3827393) monitors for new users or apps not covered by existing policies, identifies necessary updates to close security gaps, and recommends quick fixes for identity teams to apply with a single selection. For more information, see: [Microsoft Entra Conditional Access optimization agent](../security-copilot/conditional-access-agent-optimization.md).\n+\n+---\n+\n+### Public Preview - Microsoft Entra ID Governance: Suggested access packages in My Access\n+\n+**Type:** New feature    \n+**Service category:** Entitlement Management    \n+**Product capability:** Entitlement Management    \n+\n+In December 2024, we introduced a new feature in My Access: a curated list of suggested access packages. Users view the most relevant access packages, based on their peers' access packages and previous assignments, without scrolling through a long list. By May 2025, suggestions will be enabled by default and we'll introduce a new card in the Microsoft Entra Admin Center Entitlement Management control configurations for admins to see My Access settings. We recommend admins turn on the peer-based insights for suggested access packages via this setting. For more information, see: [Suggested access packages in My Access (Preview)](../id-governance/entitlement-management-suggested-access-packages.md).\n+\n+---\n+\n+### Public Preview - Conditional Access What If evaluation API\n+\n+**Type:** New feature    \n+**Service category:** Conditional Access    \n+**Product capability:** Access Control    \n+\n+Conditional Access What If evaluation API – Leverage the What If tool using the Microsoft Graph API to programmatically evaluate the applicability of Conditional Access policies in your tenant on user and service principal sign-ins. For more information, see: [conditionalAccessRoot: evaluate](/graph/api/conditionalaccessroot-evaluate).\n+\n+---\n+\n+### Public Preview - Manage refresh tokens for mover and leaver scenarios with Lifecycle Workflows\n+\n+**Type:** New feature    \n+**Service category:** Lifecycle Workflows    \n+**Product capability:** Identity Governance    \n+\n+Now customers can configure a Lifecycle workflows task to automatically revoke access tokens when employees move within, or leave, the organization. For more information, see: [Revoke all refresh tokens for user](../id-governance/lifecycle-workflow-tasks.md#revoke-all-refresh-tokens-for-user).\n+\n+---\n+\n+### General Availability - Use managed identities as credentials in Microsoft Entra apps\n+\n+**Type:** New feature    \n+**Service category:** Managed identities for Azure resources    \n+**Product capability:** Identity Security & Protection   \n+\n+You can now use managed identities as federated credentials for Microsoft Entra apps, enabling secure, secret-less authentication in both single- and multi-tenant scenarios. This eliminates the need to store and manage client secrets or certificates when using Microsoft Entra app to access Azure resources across tenants. This capability aligns with Microsoft’s [Secure Future Initiative](https://www.microsoft.com/trust-center/security/secure-future-initiative) pillar of protecting identities and secrets across systems. Learn how to configure this capability in the [official documentation](../workload-id/workload-identity-federation-config-app-trust-managed-identity.md).\n+\n+---\n+\n+### Plan for change - Roll out of Application Based Authentication on Microsoft Entra Connect Sync\n+\n+**Type:** Plan for change   \n+**Service category:** Microsoft Entra Connect    \n+**Product capability:** Microsoft Entra Connect    \n+\n+**What is changing**\n+\n+Microsoft Entra Connect creates and uses a [Microsoft Entra Connector account](../identity/hybrid/connect/reference-connect-accounts-permissions.md) to authenticate and sync identities from Active Directory to Microsoft Entra ID. The account uses a locally stored password to authenticate with Microsoft Entra ID. To enhance the security of the Microsoft Entra Connect application sync process, we will, in the coming week roll out support for \"Application based Authentication\" (ABA), which uses a Microsoft Entra ID application based identity and Oauth 2.0 client credential flow to authenticate with Microsoft Entra ID. To enable this, Microsoft Entra Connect will create a single tenant 3rd party application in customer's Microsoft Entra ID tenant, register a certificate as the credential for the application, and authorize the application to perform on-premises directory synchronization\n+\n+The Microsoft Entra Connect Sync .msi installation file for this change will be exclusively available in the Microsoft Entra admin center within the [Microsoft Entra Connect pane](https://entra.microsoft.com/#view/Microsoft_AAD_Connect_Provisioning/AADConnectMenuBlade/~/GetStarted). \n+\n+Check our [version history page](../identity/hybrid/connect/reference-connect-version-history.md) in the next week for more details of the change.\n+\n+---\n+\n+\n ## March 2025\n \n ### Microsoft Entra Permissions Management end of sale and retirement"
  },

    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/dde018218032fc49ab63f67a8e51aa79f2adc3b7/docs%2Ffundamentals%2Fwhats-new.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Ffundamentals%2Fwhats-new.md?ref=dde018218032fc49ab63f67a8e51aa79f2adc3b7",
    "patch": "@@ -9,7 +9,7 @@ ms.assetid: 06a149f7-4aa1-4fb9-a8ec-ac2633b031fb\n ms.service: entra\n ms.subservice: fundamentals\n ms.topic: reference\n-ms.date: 08/25/2025\n+ms.date: 10/30/2025\n ms.author: owinfrey\n ms.reviewer: dhanyahk\n ms.custom: it-pro, has-azure-ad-ps-ref, sfi-ga-nochange\n@@ -22,6 +22,216 @@ This article provides information about the latest releases and change announcem\n \n >Get notified about when to revisit this page for updates by copying and pasting this URL: `https://learn.microsoft.com/api/search/rss?search=%22Release+notes+-+Azure+Active+Directory%22&locale=en-us` into your ![RSS feed reader icon](./media/whats-new/feed-icon-16x16.png) feed reader.\n \n+## October 2025\n+\n+### Public Preview - Delegated Workflow Management in Lifecycle Workflows\n+\n+**Type:** New feature    \n+**Service category:** Lifecycle Workflows    \n+**Product capability:** Identity Governance    \n+\n+Lifecycle workflows can now be managed with Administrative Units (AUs), enabling organizations to segment workflows and delegate administration to specific admins. This enhancement ensures that only authorized admins can view, configure, and execute workflows relevant to their scope. Customers are able to associate workflows with AUs, assign scoped permissions to delegated admins, and ensure that workflows only impact users within their defined scope.\n+\n+---\n+\n+### Public Preview - Delegated Workflow Management in Lifecycle Workflows\n+\n+**Type:** New feature    \n+**Service category:** Lifecycle Workflows    \n+**Product capability:** Identity Governance    \n+\n+Lifecycle workflows can now be managed with Administrative Units (AUs), enabling organizations to segment workflows and delegate administration to specific admins. This enhancement ensures that only authorized admins can view, configure, and execute workflows relevant to their scope. Customers are able to associate workflows with AUs, assign scoped permissions to delegated admins, and ensure that workflows only impact users within their defined scope.\n+\n+---\n+\n+### Public preview - Expanded attribute support in Lifecycle Workflows attribute changes trigger\n+\n+**Type:** Changed feature    \n+**Service category:** Lifecycle Workflows    \n+**Product capability:** Identity Governance    \n+\n+The Attribute Changes trigger in Lifecycle Workflows now supports additional attribute types, enabling broader detection of organizational changes. Previously, this trigger was limited to a set of core attributes. With this update, you can configure workflows to respond when any of the following attributes change:\n+\n+- Custom security attributes\n+- Directory extension attributes\n+- EmployeeOrgData attributes\n+- On-premises attributes 1–15\n+\n+This enhancement gives administrators greater flexibility to automate lifecycle processes for mover events based on custom or extended attributes, improving governance for complex organizational structures and hybrid environments. For more information, see: [Use Custom attribute triggers in lifecycle workflows (Preview)](../id-governance/workflow-custom-triggers.md).\n+\n+---\n+\n+### Public Preview - Sign-in with username/alias\n+\n+**Type:** New feature    \n+**Service category:** B2C - Consumer Identity Management    \n+**Product capability:** B2B/B2C   \n+\n+In Microsoft Entra External ID (EEID), users with a local email+password credential can sign in with email address as identifier.  We are adding the ability for these users to sign in with an alternative identifier such as customer/member id, for example insurance number, frequent flier number assigned via Graph API or Microsoft Entra admin center. For more information, see [Sign in with an alias or username (preview)](/entra/external-id/customers/how-to-sign-in-alias).\n+\n+---\n+\n+### Deprecation - Iteration 2 beta APIs for Microsoft Entra PIM will be retired. Migrate to Iteration 3 APIs. \n+\n+**Type:** Deprecated   \n+**Service category:** Privileged Identity Management    \n+**Product capability:** Identity Governance   \n+\n+**Introduction**\n+\n+Starting Oct 28, 2026, all applications and scripts making calls to Microsoft Entra Privileged Identity Management (PIM) [Iteration 2](/graph/api/resources/privilegedidentitymanagement-root?view=graph-rest-beta) (beta) APIs for Azure resources, Microsoft Entra roles and Groups will fail.\n+\n+**How this will affect your organization**\n+\n+After Oct 28, 2026, any applications or scripts calling Microsoft Entra PIM Iteration 2 (beta) API endpoints will fail. These calls will no longer return data, which might disrupt workflows or integrations relying on these endpoints. These APIs were released in beta and are being retired, Iteration 3 are generally available (GA) APIs which offer improved reliability and broader scenario support.\n+\n+**What you need to do to prepare**\n+\n+We strongly recommend migrating to the **Iteration 3 (GA) APIs**, which are generally available. \n+\n+- Begin migration planning and testing as soon as possible.\n+- Halt any new development using Iteration 2 APIs.\n+- Review documentation for Iteration 3 APIs to ensure compatibility.\n+\n+Learn more: \n+\n+- [API concepts in Privileged Identity management - Microsoft Entra ID Governance | Microsoft Learn](../id-governance/privileged-identity-management/pim-apis.md)\n+- [Privileged Identity Management iteration 2 APIs](/graph/api/resources/privilegedidentitymanagement-root?view=graph-rest-beta)\n+- [Migrate from PIM iteration 2 APIs to PIM iteration 3 APIs](/graph/api/resources/privilegedidentitymanagement-root?view=graph-rest-beta#migrate-from-pim-iteration-2-apis-to-pim-iteration-3-apis)\n+\n+---\n+\n+### Public Preview - Soft Delete & Restore for Conditional Access Policies and Named Locations\n+\n+**Type:** New feature    \n+**Service category:** Conditional Access    \n+**Product capability:** Identity Security & Protection    \n+\n+We’re thrilled to announce the **Public Preview of soft delete and restore for Conditional Access (CA) policies and Named Locations** in Microsoft Entra. This new capability extends our proven soft delete model to critical security configurations across **Microsoft Graph APIs (in beta) and the Microsoft Entra Admin Center**, helping admins recover from accidental or malicious deletions quickly and strengthen overall security posture.\n+\n+With this feature, admins can:\n+\n+- Restore deleted items to their exact prior state within 30 days  \n+- Review deleted items before restoring   \n+- Permanently delete when needed\n+\n+Soft delete has already been proven at scale across Microsoft Entra (7M+ objects restored in the last 30 days). Bringing it to CA policies and Named Locations ensure quick disaster recovery, minimizes downtime, and maintains security integrity.\n+\n+---\n+\n+### General Availability - Suggested Access Packages can be shown to users in My Access\n+\n+**Type:** New feature    \n+**Service category:** Entitlement Management    \n+**Product capability:** Entitlement Management    \n+\n+In My Access, Microsoft Entra ID Governance users can see a curated list of suggested access packages in My Access. This capability allows users to quickly view the most relevant access packages for them based off their peers' access packages and previous assignments without scrolling through all their available access packages.\n+\n+The suggested access packages list is created by finding people related to the user (manager, direct reports, organization, team members) and recommending access packages based on what the users’ peers have. The user is also suggested access packages that were previously assigned to them.\n+\n+We recommend admins turn on the peer-based insights for suggested access packages via this setting. For more information, see: [Suggested access packages in My Access](../id-governance/entitlement-management-suggested-access-packages.md)\n+\n+---\n+\n+### General Availability - Conversion of external users to internal members\n+\n+**Type:** New feature    \n+**Service category:** User Management    \n+**Product capability:** User Management    \n+\n+External user conversion enables customers to convert external users to internal members without needing to delete and create new user objects. Maintaining the same underlying object ensures the user’s account and access to resources isn’t disrupted and that their history of activities remains intact as their relationship with the host organization changes. \n+\n+The external to internal user conversion feature includes the ability to convert on-premises synchronized users as well.\n+\n+---\n+\n+### General Availability - Granular, Least-Privileged Permissions for UserAuthenticationMethod APIs\n+\n+**Type:** New feature    \n+**Service category:** MS Graph    \n+**Product capability:** Developer Experience    \n+\n+**Summary**\n+\n+We're introducing new, granular permissions for the UserAuthenticationMethod APIs in Microsoft Entra ID. This update enables organizations to apply the principle of least privilege when managing authentication methods, supporting both security and operational efficiency.\n+\n+**What’s New?**\n+\n+- **New per-method permissions:** Fine-grained permissions for each authentication method (for example, Password, Microsoft Authenticator, Phone, Email, Temporary Access Pass, Passkey, Windows Hello for Business, QR+PIN, and others).\n+- **Read-only policy permission:** A new permission allows read-only access to authentication method policies, improving role separation and auditability.\n+\n+For more information, see [Microsoft Graph permissions reference - Microsoft Graph | Microsoft Learn](/graph/permissions-reference)\n+\n+---\n+\n+### Public Preview - Cloud Managed Remote Mailboxes\n+\n+**Type:** New feature    \n+**Service category:** User Management    \n+**Product capability:** Microsoft Entra Cloud Sync    \n+\n+The Source of Authority (SOA) at the object level allows administrators to convert specific users synced from Active Directory (AD) to Microsoft Entra ID into cloud-editable objects, which are no longer synced from AD and act as if originally created in the cloud. This feature supports a gradual migration process, decreasing dependencies on AD while aiming to minimize user and operational impact. Both Microsoft Entra Connect Sync and Cloud Sync recognize the SOA switch for these objects. The option to switch the SOA of synced users from AD to Microsoft Entra ID is currently available in Public Preview. For more information, see: [Embrace cloud-first posture: Transfer user Source of Authority (SOA) to the cloud (Preview)](../identity/hybrid/user-source-of-authority-overview.md).\n+\n+---\n+\n+### Public Preview - Prefetch Workday termination data to customize account disable logic\n+\n+**Type:** Fixed    \n+**Service category:** Provisioning    \n+**Product capability:** Inbound to Microsoft Entra ID    \n+\n+This Workday connector update resolves termination processing delays observed for workers in APAC and ANZ regions. Admins can now enable termination lookahead setting to prefetch data and tailor deprovisioning logic for accounts in Microsoft Entra ID and on-premises Active Directory. For more information, see: [Configure Workday termination lookahead (Preview)](../identity/app-provisioning/configure-workday-termination-lookahead.md).\n+\n+---\n+\n+### General Availability - Ability to convert Source of Authority of synced on-premises AD groups to cloud groups is now available \n+\n+**Type:** New feature    \n+**Service category:** Group Management    \n+**Product capability:** Microsoft Entra Cloud Sync    \n+\n+The Group SOA feature lets organizations move application access governance from on-premises to the cloud by transferring Active Directory group authority to Microsoft Entra ID using Connect Sync or Cloud Sync. With phased migration, admins can reduce AD dependencies gradually and minimize disruption. Microsoft Entra ID Governance manages access for both cloud and on-premises apps linked to security groups, and customers of either sync client can now use this feature. For more information, see: [Group source of authority](https://aka.ms/groupsoadocs).\n+\n+---\n+\n+### Plan for Change - Jailbreak Detection in Authenticator App\n+\n+**Type:** Plan for change    \n+**Service category:** Microsoft Authenticator App    \n+**Product capability:** Identity Security & Protection    \n+\n+**Starting February 2026**, we'll introduce **Jailbreak/Root detection for Microsoft Entra credentials in the Authenticator app**. This update strengthens security by preventing Microsoft Entra credentials from functioning on jail-broken or rooted devices. All existing credentials on such devices will be wiped to protect your organization.\n+\n+This capability is secure by default and requires no admin configuration or control. The change applies to both iOS and Android.This change won't apply to personal or third party accounts.\n+\n+**Action required:** Notify end users about this upcoming change. Authenticator will become unusable for Microsoft Entra accounts on jail-broken or rooted devices.\n+\n+For more information, see: [About Microsoft Authenticator](https://support.microsoft.com/account-billing/about-microsoft-authenticator-9783c865-0308-42fb-a519-8cf666fe0acc).\n+\n+---\n+\n+### Public Preview - Global Secure Access B2B support with AVD and W365\n+\n+**Type:** New feature    \n+**Service category:** B2B    \n+**Product capability:** Network Access    \n+\n+Guest access support for Global Secure Access (GSA) using W365 and AVD is now in public preview. This B2B support addresses secure access using GSA to external identities such as Guests, Partners, Contractors using Windows Cloud - Azure Virtual Desktop (AVD), and Windows 365 (W365). This feature empowers 3rd party users from a foreign tenant to securely access resources within a company’s tenant also known as the resource tenant. As a resource tenant administrator, you can enable Private Access, Internet Access, and Microsoft 365 traffic to these 3rd party users.\n+\n+For more information, see: [Learn about Global Secure Access B2B Guest Access (Preview) - Global Secure Access | Microsoft Learn](../global-secure-access/concept-b2b-guest-access.md).\n+\n+---\n+\n+### Public Preview - Global Secure Access Internet profile support for iOS client\n+\n+**Type:** New feature    \n+**Service category:** Internet Access    \n+**Product capability:** Network Access    \n+\n+Kerberos SSO experience for users on mobile devices with Global Secure Access is now supported. On IOS, create and deploy profile for Single sign-on app extension, see: [Single sign-on app extension](/intune/intune-service/configuration/ios-device-features-settings#single-sign-on-app-extension). On Android. You need to install and configure a 3rd party SSO client.\n+\n+---\n+\n ## September 2025\n \n ### Public Preview - Convert Source of Authority of synced Active Directory users to the cloud\n@@ -92,7 +302,7 @@ As part of ongoing security hardening, Microsoft has deployed a dedicated first-\n \n Microsoft Entra Connect now uses this first party application to synchronize between Active Directory and Microsoft Entra ID. Customers are required to upgrade to version **2.5.79.0** or later by **September 2026**. \n \n-We'll auto-upgrade customers where supported. For customers who wish to be auto-upgraded, [ensure that you have auto-upgrade configured](../identity/hybrid/connect/how-to-connect-install-automatic-upgrade.md).  \n+We auto-upgrade customers where supported. For customers who wish to be auto-upgraded, [ensure that you have auto-upgrade configured](../identity/hybrid/connect/how-to-connect-install-automatic-upgrade.md).  \n \n The Microsoft Entra Connect Sync .msi installation file for this change is exclusively available on Microsoft Entra admin center under [Microsoft Entra Connect](https://entra.microsoft.com/#view/Microsoft_AAD_Connect_Provisioning/AADConnectMenuBlade/~/GetStarted).\n \n@@ -697,71 +907,3 @@ Deployment logs feature provide visibility into the status and progress of confi\n \n ---\n \n-\n-## April 2025\n-\n-### Public Preview -  Conditional Access Optimization Agent in Microsoft Entra \n-\n-**Type:** New feature    \n-**Service category:** Conditional Access    \n-**Product capability:** Identity Security & Protection    \n-\n-[Conditional Access Optimization Agent in Microsoft Entra](https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/blog/microsoft-entra-blog/new-innovations-in-microsoft-entra-to-strengthen-ai-security-and-identity-protec/3827393) monitors for new users or apps not covered by existing policies, identifies necessary updates to close security gaps, and recommends quick fixes for identity teams to apply with a single selection. For more information, see: [Microsoft Entra Conditional Access optimization agent](../security-copilot/conditional-access-agent-optimization.md).\n-\n----\n-\n-### Public Preview - Microsoft Entra ID Governance: Suggested access packages in My Access\n-\n-**Type:** New feature    \n-**Service category:** Entitlement Management    \n-**Product capability:** Entitlement Management    \n-\n-In December 2024, we introduced a new feature in My Access: a curated list of suggested access packages. Users view the most relevant access packages, based on their peers' access packages and previous assignments, without scrolling through a long list. By May 2025, suggestions will be enabled by default and we'll introduce a new card in the Microsoft Entra Admin Center Entitlement Management control configurations for admins to see My Access settings. We recommend admins turn on the peer-based insights for suggested access packages via this setting. For more information, see: [Suggested access packages in My Access (Preview)](../id-governance/entitlement-management-suggested-access-packages.md).\n-\n----\n-\n-### Public Preview - Conditional Access What If evaluation API\n-\n-**Type:** New feature    \n-**Service category:** Conditional Access    \n-**Product capability:** Access Control    \n-\n-Conditional Access What If evaluation API – Leverage the What If tool using the Microsoft Graph API to programmatically evaluate the applicability of Conditional Access policies in your tenant on user and service principal sign-ins. For more information, see: [conditionalAccessRoot: evaluate](/graph/api/conditionalaccessroot-evaluate).\n-\n----\n-\n-### Public Preview - Manage refresh tokens for mover and leaver scenarios with Lifecycle Workflows\n-\n-**Type:** New feature    \n-**Service category:** Lifecycle Workflows    \n-**Product capability:** Identity Governance    \n-\n-Now customers can configure a Lifecycle workflows task to automatically revoke access tokens when employees move within, or leave, the organization. For more information, see: [Revoke all refresh tokens for user](../id-governance/lifecycle-workflow-tasks.md#revoke-all-refresh-tokens-for-user).\n-\n----\n-\n-### General Availability - Use managed identities as credentials in Microsoft Entra apps\n-\n-**Type:** New feature    \n-**Service category:** Managed identities for Azure resources    \n-**Product capability:** Identity Security & Protection   \n-\n-You can now use managed identities as federated credentials for Microsoft Entra apps, enabling secure, secret-less authentication in both single- and multi-tenant scenarios. This eliminates the need to store and manage client secrets or certificates when using Microsoft Entra app to access Azure resources across tenants. This capability aligns with Microsoft’s [Secure Future Initiative](https://www.microsoft.com/trust-center/security/secure-future-initiative) pillar of protecting identities and secrets across systems. Learn how to configure this capability in the [official documentation](../workload-id/workload-identity-federation-config-app-trust-managed-identity.md).\n-\n----\n-\n-### Plan for change - Roll out of Application Based Authentication on Microsoft Entra Connect Sync\n-\n-**Type:** Plan for change   \n-**Service category:** Microsoft Entra Connect    \n-**Product capability:** Microsoft Entra Connect    \n-\n-**What is changing**\n-\n-Microsoft Entra Connect creates and uses a [Microsoft Entra Connector account](../identity/hybrid/connect/reference-connect-accounts-permissions.md) to authenticate and sync identities from Active Directory to Microsoft Entra ID. The account uses a locally stored password to authenticate with Microsoft Entra ID. To enhance the security of the Microsoft Entra Connect application sync process, we will, in the coming week roll out support for \"Application based Authentication\" (ABA), which uses a Microsoft Entra ID application based identity and Oauth 2.0 client credential flow to authenticate with Microsoft Entra ID. To enable this, Microsoft Entra Connect will create a single tenant 3rd party application in customer's Microsoft Entra ID tenant, register a certificate as the credential for the application, and authorize the application to perform on-premises directory synchronization\n-\n-The Microsoft Entra Connect Sync .msi installation file for this change will be exclusively available in the Microsoft Entra admin center within the [Microsoft Entra Connect pane](https://entra.microsoft.com/#view/Microsoft_AAD_Connect_Provisioning/AADConnectMenuBlade/~/GetStarted). \n-\n-Check our [version history page](../identity/hybrid/connect/reference-connect-version-history.md) in the next week for more details of the change.\n-\n----"

    "patch": "@@ -16,7 +16,7 @@ ms.custom: template-how-to\n Lifecycle workflows allow for tasks associated with the lifecycle process to be run automatically for users as they move through their lifecycle in your organization. Workflows consist of:\n \n - **Tasks**: Actions taken when a workflow is triggered.\n-- **Execution conditions**: The who and when of a workflow. These conditions define which users (scope) this workflow should run against, and when (trigger) the workflow should run.\n+- **Execution conditions**: The who and when of a workflow. These conditions define which users this workflow should run against, and when (trigger) the workflow should run.\n \n You can create and customize workflows for common scenarios by using templates, or you can build a workflow from scratch without using a template. Currently, if you use the Microsoft Entra admin center, any workflow that you create must be based on a template. If you want to create a workflow without using a template, use Microsoft Graph.\n \n@@ -39,7 +39,7 @@ To create a workflow based on a template:\n 1. On the **Basics** tab, enter a unique display name and description for the workflow, and then select **Next**.\n+1.   {
    "sha": "af16f2304bed8ba4b2ef011ac43ccf639dd486db",
    "filename": "docs/id-governance/manage-delegate-workflow.md",
    "status": "added",
    "additions": 174,
    "deletions": 0,
    "changes": 174,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/dde018218032fc49ab63f67a8e51aa79f2adc3b7/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fmanage-delegate-workflow.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/dde018218032fc49ab63f67a8e51aa79f2adc3b7/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fmanage-delegate-workflow.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fmanage-delegate-workflow.md?ref=dde018218032fc49ab63f67a8e51aa79f2adc3b7",
    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,174 @@\n+---\n+title: Delegated Workflow Management (Preview)\n+description: This article informs a user about delegating management of workflows using Lifecycle workflows.\n+author: owinfreyATL\n+ms.author: owinfrey\n+ms.service: entra-id-governance\n+ms.subservice: lifecycle-workflows\n+ms.topic: how-to \n+ms.date: 07/31/2025\n+\n+#CustomerIntent: As a Lifecycle Workflow administrator, I want to delegate management of specific lifecycle workflows so that workflow management is more granular.\n+---\n+\n+\n+# Delegated workflow management (preview)\n+\n+Workflows by default, unless specified during creation, are managed by users with either the Lifecycle Workflows, or Global, administrator roles. As workflows grow and change to meet the needs of members of your organization, so does the need to limit who can manage them. With delegated workflow management, you can scope management of workflows using [Administrative Units](../identity/role-based-access-control/administrative-units.md). When scoped, specific admins are only granted access to manage specific workflows. Scoping allows for greater security within your environment by following Microsoft's least privileged access guidelines by only giving access to specifically what's needed.\n+\n+The following table shows the differences between the Lifecycle Workflows Administrator role, and the scoped workflow administrator role in terms of Lifecycle workflow capabilities:\n+\n+\n+|Capability | Lifecycle Workflows Administrator  | Workflow Administrator  |\n+|-----------|-----------------------------------|------------------------|\n+|[Create Workflow](create-lifecycle-workflow.md)    | Yes | No |\n+|[Edit Workflow](manage-workflow-properties.md)    | Yes | Yes (only assigned workflows) |\n+|[Custom Task Extensions](trigger-custom-task.md)    | Yes | No |\n+|[Delete Workflow](delete-lifecycle-workflow.md#delete-a-workflow-by-using-the-microsoft-entra-admin-center)    | Yes | Yes (only assigned workflows) |\n+|[Restore Workflow](delete-lifecycle-workflow.md#view-deleted-workflows-in-the-microsoft-entra-admin-center)     | Yes | Yes (only assigned workflows) |\n+|[View workflow history](lifecycle-workflow-history.md)     | Yes | Yes (only assigned workflows) |\n+|[Run Workflow on-demand](on-demand-workflow.md)    | Yes | Yes (only assigned workflows) |\n+|[Scope Workflows](manage-delegate-workflow.md#edit-the-administrative-scopes-of-an-existing-workflow-using-the-microsoft-entra-admin-center)     | Yes | No |\n+\n+## Prerequisites\n+\n+[!INCLUDE [Microsoft Entra ID Governance license](~/includes/entra-entra-governance-license.md)] You must also have at least one administrative unit within your tenant. For steps on creating an administrative unit, see [Create an administrative unit](../identity/role-based-access-control/admin-units-manage.md#create-an-administrative-unit).\n+\n+\n+## Assign Lifecycle Workflows Administrator role to administrative unit\n+\n+To delegate workflow management using administrative scopes, you must first assign the Lifecycle Workflows administrator role to the administrative unit. To do so, you'd follow these steps:\n+\n+> [!TIP]\n+> While the following steps walk you through setting the role for a specific user, you can set the role to a group within the administrative unit to delegate management within a scope to multiple users.\n+\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least a [Privileged Role Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#privileged-role-administrator).\n+\n+1. Browse to **Entra ID** > **Users**.\n+\n+1. On the users page, select the user you want to assign the admin scope to.\n+\n+1. From the user overview page, select **Assigned roles**.\n+\n+1. On the assigned roles page, select **Add assignments**.\n+\n+1. On the add assignments page select the following:<br>\n+    **Select role**: Lifecycle Workflows Administrator<br>\n+    **Scope type**: Administrative unit\n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/manage-delegate-workflow/add-administrative-unit.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of adding administrative unit.\":::\n+1. On the **Selected scope** pane, select the administrative unit where your workflow will be scoped to, and select **Next**.\n+\n+1. On the **Setting** tab, you can set the assignment as either **Eligible** or **Active**.\n+    > [!NOTE]\n+    > Assignment must be active to run for users in the administrative unit.\n+1. Select **Save**.\n+\n+\n+## Add administrative scopes to a new workflow\n+\n+To add an administrative scope to a new workflow, set the administrative scope during workflow creation by doing the following steps:\n+\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least a [Lifecycle Workflows Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#lifecycle-workflows-administrator).\n+\n+1. Browse to **ID Governance** > **Lifecycle workflows** > **Create a workflow**.\n+\n+1. On the **Choose a workflow** page, select the workflow template that you want to use.\n+\n+1. On the **Basics** tab, enter a unique display name, description, and administrative scope for the workflow, and then select **Next**. \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/manage-delegate-workflow/create-admin-scope.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of setting admin scope of a new workflow.\":::\n+1. Finish setting the execution conditions, tasks, and create the workflow.\n+\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> You can assign up to five administrative scopes per workflow.\n+\n+## Edit the administrative scopes of an existing workflow using the Microsoft Entra admin center\n+\n+With the role set for admins over the administrative unit, you must edit the workflow to be assigned within the scope of that administrative unit. To edit the properties of a workflow to be in an administrative unit's scope using the Microsoft Entra admin center, you do the following steps:\n+\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least a [Lifecycle Workflows Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#lifecycle-workflows-administrator).\n+\n+1. Browse to **ID Governance** > **Lifecycle workflows** > **workflows**.\n+\n+1. On the list of workflows page, select the workflow that you want to edit the administrative scopes of.\n+\n+1. On the workflow overview page, select **Administration Scope**.\n+    > [!TIP]\n+    > You can also select the **Administration scope (Preview)** card on the overview page to get to the administration scope page.\n+1. On the administration scope page, select **Assign Administration scope**.\n+\n+1. From the administration scope pane, you can see the list of all administrative units in your tenant. \n+\n+1. Select the administrative unit(s) you want to scope the workflow to. \n+\n+1. Select **Save**.\n+\n+## Assign Lifecycle Workflows Administrator role to administrative unit programmatically \n+\n+To assign Lifecycle workflow admins to an administrative unit scope via API, you must have the following information:\n+\n+- Lifecycle Workflow admin role ID: 59d46f88-662b-457b-bceb-5c3809e5908f\n+- User ID for user you want to assign the scope\n+- ID of Admin Unit you want to assign\n+\n+With this information, you can make the following API call:\n+\n+POST https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/roleManagement/directory/roleAssignments\n+\n+```\n+{\n+    \"@odata.type\": \"#microsoft.graph.unifiedRoleAssignment\",\n+    \"principalId\": \"<Object ID of user>\",\n+    \"roleDefinitionId\": \"59d46f88-662b-457b-bceb-5c3809e5908f\",\n+    \"directoryScopeId\": \"/administrativeUnits/<Object ID of administrative unit>\"\n+}\n+```\n+\n+## View the administrative scopes of a workflow using the Microsoft Entra admin center\n+\n+When managing workflows, it's important to see what administrative scopes they fall under. This allows you to quickly see who can manage each specific workflow. To see the administrative scopes of a workflow, do the following steps:\n+\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least a [Lifecycle Workflows Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#lifecycle-workflows-administrator).\n+\n+1. Browse to **ID Governance** > **Lifecycle workflows** > **workflows**.\n+\n+1. On the workflow list screen, you can see the number of scopes assigned to the workflow under the **Administration scope assigned** column.\n+\n+1. Select the number in the column to see the list of scopes assigned to that workflow.\n+\n+\n+## Remove the administrative scopes of a workflow using the Microsoft Entra admin center\n+\n+Administration scopes can be removed from a workflow at any time. To remove an administrative unit scope from a workflow, do the following steps:\n+\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least a [Lifecycle Workflows Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#lifecycle-workflows-administrator).\n+\n+1. Browse to **ID Governance** > **Lifecycle workflows** > **workflows**.\n+\n+1. On the list of workflows page, select the workflow that you want to remove an administrative scope from.\n+\n+1. On the workflow overview page, select **Properties**.\n+\n+1. Under properties, select **Administrative Scope**.\n+\n+1. From the administrative scope pane, you can see the list of all administrative scopes of the workflow.\n+\n+1. Select the administration scope you want to remove the workflow from.\n+\n+1. Select **Save**. \n+\n+## Edit the administrative scopes of a workflow using Microsoft Graph\n+\n+To edit the administrative scopes of a workflow via API using Microsoft Graph, see: [Update workflow](/graph/api/identitygovernance-workflow-createnewversion).\n+\n+## View the administrative scopes of a workflow using Microsoft Graph\n+\n+To view the administrative scopes of a workflow via API using Microsoft Graph, see: [Update workflow](/graph/api/identitygovernance-workflow-get).\n+\n+## Remove the administrative scopes of a workflow using Microsoft Graph\n+\n+To remove the administrative scopes of a workflow via API using Microsoft Graph, see: [Update workflow](/graph/api/identitygovernance-workflow-createnewversion).\n+\n+## Next steps\n+\n+- [Manage workflow properties](manage-workflow-properties.md)\n+- [Check status of a workflows](check-status-workflow.md)"
  },
  {

    "patch": "@@ -20,6 +20,7 @@ Managing workflows can be accomplished in one of two ways:\n You can update the following basic information without creating a new workflow.\n    - display name\n    - description\n+   - [Administrative Unit Scope](manage-delegate-workflow.md)\n    - whether or not it's enabled\n    - Whether or not workflow schedule is enabled\n    - task name\n@@ -41,13 +42,13 @@ To edit the properties of a workflow using the Microsoft Entra admin center, you\n     \n     :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/manage-workflow-properties/manage-list.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the workflow list.\":::\n \n-6. To change the display name or description, select **Properties**.\n+6. To change the display name, description, or the Administrative unit scope, select **Properties**.\n \n     :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/manage-workflow-properties/manage-properties.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the basic properties screen.\":::\n \n-7. Update the display name or description how you want. \n+7. Update the desired properties. \n > [!NOTE]\n-> Display names can not be the same as other existing workflows. They must have their own unique name.\n+> Display names cannot be the same as other existing workflows. They must have their own unique name.\n \n 8. Select **save**.\n "

    "patch": "@@ -61,7 +61,7 @@ Use the following steps to create a mover workflow for a user making a job chang\n \n 1. From the templates, select **Employee job profile change**.\n     :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/tutorial-mover-custom-workflow-portal/job-change-template.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of selecting the employee job profile change template.\":::\n-1. You're also able to choose the **Trigger type** of the workflow, which in this case is the **Attribute changes** trigger. For **Trigger attribute** you're able to define what attribute being changed will trigger the workflow, which in this case is **department**. After the trigger is set, select **Configure scope**.\n+1. Next, you configure the basic information about the workflow. This information includes a name, description, and [administrative scope](manage-delegate-workflow.md). You're also able to choose the **Trigger type** of the workflow, which in this case is the **Attribute changes** trigger. For **Trigger attribute** you're able to define what attribute being changed will trigger the workflow, which in this case is **department**. After the trigger is set, select **Configure scope**.\n     :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/tutorial-mover-custom-workflow-portal/job-change-template-basics.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of setting attribute change membership trigger in template.\":::\n 1. On the next screen you configure the scope. The scope determines which users this workflow runs against.  In this case, it is on all users added to the Sales department. On the configure scope screen, under **Rule** add the following settings, and then select **Review tasks**. For a full list of supported user properties, see [Supported user properties and query parameters](/graph/api/resources/identitygovernance-rulebasedsubjectset?view=graph-rest-beta&preserve-view=true#supported-user-properties-and-query-parameters).\n     :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/tutorial-mover-custom-workflow-portal/group-scope.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of setting attribute change scope.\":::"

]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary.","role":"user"}
ai_summary.Response: The latest updates to Microsoft Entra documentation include new features and enhancements across various services. Key additions are the public preview of Delegated Workflow Management in Lifecycle Workflows, allowing for granular control and administration of workflows, and the introduction of a dedicated first-party application for Microsoft Entra Connect Sync to improve security. Additionally, new release notes for October 2025 detail features like expanded attribute support in Lifecycle Workflows and the deprecation of Iteration 2 beta APIs for Microsoft Entra PIM. Several files have been modified to reflect these changes, including updates to the 'What's New' archives and specific feature documentation.

    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-customize-branding-customers.md?ref=dd05658dde87ca5be69bd3b18c64b06a4851c0b0",

F\n \n ## Related content\n \n-In this article we learned how to customize the look and feel of the customer sign-in and sign-up experience. To learn more about customizing the language of the tenant, see the [Language customization](how-to-customize-languages-customers.md) article.\n-For an understanding of the differences in workforce tenant branding, see the article [How to customize branding for your workforce](~/fundamentals/how-to-customize-branding.md).\n+- To learn more about customizing the language of the tenant, see [Language customization](how-to-customize-languages-customers.md).\n+- For an understanding of the differences in workforce tenant branding, see the [How to customize branding for your workforce](~/fundamentals/how-to-customize-branding.md).\n+- For information about how create unique authentication experiences for applications in your tenant, see [Customize the sign-in experience for your application with branding themes in external tenants](how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "3c2d0898fcad6af9b8c8e74886d77e4276f5f85b",
    "filename": "docs/external-id/customers/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md",
    "status": "added",
    "additions": 237,
    "deletions": 0,
    "changes": 237,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/dd05658dde87ca5be69bd3b18c64b06a4851c0b0/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/dd05658dde87ca5be69bd3b18c64b06a4851c0b0/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md?ref=dd05658dde87ca5be69bd3b18c64b06a4851c0b0",
    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,237 @@\n+---\n+title: Customize the sign-in experience for your application with branding themes in external tenants (Preview)\n+description: Learn about how to create branding themes and apply them to the sign-in experience for your application in Microsoft External ID for external tenants.\n+author: rolyon\n+manager: pmwongera\n+ms.author: rolyon\n+ms.date: 10/30/2025\n+ms.reviewer: \n+ms.service: identity-platform\n+ms.topic: how-to\n+#Customer intent: As a developer integrating with Microsoft Entra ID, I want to customize the sign-in experience for my application.\n+\n+---\n+\n+# Customize the sign-in experience for your application with branding themes in external tenants (Preview)\n+\n+[!INCLUDE [applies-to-external-only](../includes/applies-to-external-only.md)]\n+\n+> [!IMPORTANT]\n+> Branding themes for applications are currently in PREVIEW.\n+> This information relates to a prerelease product that might be substantially modified before it's released. Microsoft makes no warranties, expressed or implied, with respect to the information provided here.\n+\n+You can create unique authentication experiences for applications in your tenant. Each application can have its own theme that you can customize with a background image or color, favicon, layout, header, and footer. This customization overrides any configurations made to the default branding. If you don't make any changes to the elements, the default elements are displayed.\n+\n+This article describes how you can create multiple branding themes for different applications in your tenant.\n+\n+## Prerequisites\n+\n+- Have at least the [Organizational Branding Administrator](../../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#organizational-branding-administrator) role.\n+- Have at least the [Application Administrator](../../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#application-administrator) role for applications that you want to apply a theme to.\n+- A registered application in your tenant. If you haven't registered an application yet, see [Register an application](../../identity-platform/quickstart-register-app.md).\n+- Review the file size requirements for each image you want to add. Use a photo editor if needed to create correctly sized and formatted images: PNG, JPG, or JPEG with image size 245x36px and maximum file size 10KB.\n+\n+## Branding theme properties\n+\n+When you create a branding theme, here are some of the properties you can customize.\n+\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/sign-in-page-map.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the sign-in page, with each of the default branding elements highlighted.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/sign-in-page-map.png\":::\n+\n+| Property | Description |\n+| --- | --- |\n+| Favicon | Small icon that appears on the left side of the browser tab. |\n+| Header | Space across the top of the sign-in page, behind the header log. |\n+| Header logo | Logo that appears in the upper-left corner of the sign-in page. |\n+| Background image | The entire space behind the sign-in box. |\n+| Page background color | The entire space behind the sign-in box. |\n+| Banner logo | Logo that appears at the top of the sign-in box |\n+| Sign-in page title | Larger text that appears below the banner logo. |\n+| Sign-in page description | Text to describe the sign-in page. |\n+| Username hint and text | The text that appears before a user enters their information. |\n+| Sign-in display message box | Text you can add below the username field. |\n+| Footer link: Privacy & Cookies | Link you can add to the lower-right corner for privacy information. |\n+| Footer: Terms of Use | Text in the lower-right corner of the page where you can add Terms of use information. |\n+| Footer | Space across the bottom of the page for privacy and Terms of Use information. |\n+| Template | The layout of the page and sign-in boxes. |\n+\n+## How branding themes work\n+\n+Branding themes build on neutral branding and default branding.\n+\n+- **Branding theme** - Customizations of the default branding where you can have multiple themes.\n+- **Default branding (company branding)** - Customizations of the neutral branding for a tenant.\n+- **Neutral branding** - Initial branding for a tenant.\n+\n+Here are some important things to know about how branding themes work.\n+\n+- Branding themes can be applied to specific applications, while default branding applies tenant-wide.\n+- Default branding is used as fallback for any properties not defined in the branding theme.\n+- Neutral branding is used for any properties not defined in default branding.\n+\n+## Limits and constraints\n+\n+Here are some of the limits and constraints for branding themes.\n+\n+- You can create up to 5 branding themes per tenant.\n+- The live preview capability previews style and layout changes and only shows the Sign in page. Live preview doesn't include any custom text overrides.\n+- You can't use the name **Default theme** for your branding theme name. This name is reserved.\n+- Custom text changes are currently limited to sign-in page only.\n+- If you don't update the banner logo property, the Microsoft logo is displayed instead of the tenant name (neutral branding).\n+\n+## Create a new theme\n+\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com/) as [Organizational Branding Administrator](../../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#organizational-branding-administrator) and [Application Administrator](../../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#application-administrator).\n+\n+1. Browse to **Entra ID** > **Custom branding**.\n+\n+1. On the **Company branding** page, select **Branding themes** and then select the **Themes** tab.\n+   \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/create-new-theme.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Company Branding page and the Themes tab.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/create-new-theme.png\":::\n+\n+1. Select **Create new theme**.\n+   \n+1. On the **Basics** tab, enter a **Name** for your theme.\n+\n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/add-application-to-theme.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Create a theme page and the Basics tab to apply themes to applications.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/add-application-to-theme.png\":::\n+\n+1. To select the applications that will use this theme, under **Apply theme to**, select **Add applications**. (Or you can [add applications later](#apply-a-theme-to-applications).)\n+\n+1. On the **Layout** tab, select the placement of web page elements on the sign-in page.\n+\n+   - **Layout template** – Choose whether the sign-in pane is centre-aligned on the page or right-aligned.\n+   - **Header** – To show an image in a page header, select the checkbox and browse for the image you want to display. Requirements: Transparent PNG, JPG, or JPEG with image size 245x36px and maximum file size 10KB.\n+   - **Footer** – To show a page footer that includes links to your published privacy and cookies and/or terms of use statements, select the appropriate checkbox, enter the link text, and add the URL for your content.\n+     \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/layout-tab.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Create a theme page and the Layout tab to specify the sign-in experience.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/layout-tab.png\":::\n+\n+1. Select the **Preview** button to see your changes to the layout.\n+   \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/preview-button.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Preview button to preview a layout.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/preview-button.png\":::\n+\n+1. On the **Styling** tab, modify any of the background elements.\n+\n+   - **Background color** – The color that replaces the background image whenever the image can't be loaded, for example due to connection latency.\n+   - **Background image** – The large image that displays on the sign-in page. If you upload an image, it scales and crops to fill the browser window.\n+   - **Favicon** – The icon that displays in the web browser tab.\n+   - **Banner logo** – Displays on the sign-in page and in the user's access panel.\n+   - **Square logo (light theme)** – Represents user accounts in your tenant.\n+   - **Square logo (dark theme)** – If the light theme square logo displays poorly on dark backgrounds, you can upload a logo to be used in its place when dark backgrounds are used.\n+   - **Custom CSS** – Upload your own CSS file to replace default Microsoft styling with your own styling for: color, font, text size, position of elements, and displays for different devices and screen sizes. For more information, see [CSS template reference guide](../../fundamentals/reference-company-branding-css-template.md).\n+     \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/styling-tab.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Create a theme page and the Styling tab settings.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/styling-tab.png\":::\n+\n+1. Select the **Preview** button to see your styling changes.\n+   \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/sign-in.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the customized Sign in experience.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/sign-in.png\":::\n+\n+1. On the **Custom text** tab, for the **Sign-in** page, select the **Default** link.\n+\n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/custom-text-tab.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Create a theme page and the Custom text tab settings.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/custom-text-tab.png\":::\n+\n+1. Customize the text for the selected page and then select **Add**.\n+\n+    Custom text set for a theme might impact localized UX as they will not be localized. To ensure full localization of all text, set custom text for each theme language.\n+  \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/custom-text-edit.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Edit custom text page for the Sign-in page.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/custom-text-edit.png\":::\n+\n+1. On the **Review** tab, review your settings.\n+\n+1. Select **Create** to create the theme.\n+\n+## Apply a theme to applications\n+\n+In this section, you apply a theme to applications in your tenant.\n+\n+1. On the **Branding Themes** page, select the **Themes** tab.\n+\n+1. Select a theme you created to open the overview.\n+\n+1. Under **Basics**, select the pencil edit icon.\n+  \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/edit-theme-overview.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Overview tab of the edit theme page.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/edit-theme-overview.png\":::\n+\n+1. Under **Apply theme to**, select **Edit** to edit the list of applications.\n+  \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/edit-basics.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Edit Basics page to edit the list of applications.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/edit-basics.png\":::\n+\n+1. Search for or browse to your application. Select the check box, and then choose **Select**.\n+   \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/select-application.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Add applications page to select applications.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/select-application.png\":::\n+\n+## Edit a theme\n+\n+In this section, you edit a theme.\n+\n+1. On the **Branding Themes** page, select the **Themes** tab.\n+\n+1. Select a theme you created to open the overview.\n+\n+1. Select the pencil edit icon of the parts you want to edit.\n+\n+## Add a language to a theme\n+\n+In this section, you add a language to a theme.\n+\n+1. On the **Branding Themes** page, select the **Themes** tab.\n+\n+1. Select a theme you created to open the overview.\n+\n+1. On the **Languages** tab, select **Add a language** to customize the language of the theme.\n+\n+    The steps for customizing the language are similar to customizing branding theme.\n+  \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/languages-tab.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Languages tab to add a language.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/languages-tab.png\":::\n+\n+1. On the **Basics** tab, select a language.\n+  \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/language-basics-tab.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Add a language page and Basics tab to select a language.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/language-basics-tab.png\":::\n+\n+    The following languages are supported:\n+    \n+    - Arabic (Saudi Arabia)\n+    - Basque (Basque)\n+    - Bulgarian (Bulgaria)\n+    - Catalan (Catalan)\n+    - Chinese (China)\n+    - Chinese (Hong Kong SAR)\n+    - Croatian (Croatia)\n+    - Czech (Czechia)\n+    - Danish (Denmark)\n+    - Dutch (Netherlands)\n+    - English (United States)\n+    - Estonian (Estonia)\n+    - Finnish (Finland)\n+    - French (France)\n+    - Galician (Galician)\n+    - German (Germany)\n+    - Greek (Greece)\n+    - Hebrew (Israel)\n+    - Hungarian (Hungary)\n+    - Italian (Italy)\n+    - Japanese (Japan)\n+    - Kazakh (Kazakhstan)\n+    - Korean (Korea)\n+    - Latvian (Latvia)\n+    - Lithuanian (Lithuania)\n+    - Norwegian Bokmål (Norway)\n+    - Polish (Poland)\n+    - Portuguese (Brazil)\n+    - Portuguese (Portugal)\n+    - Romanian (Romania)\n+    - Russian (Russia)\n+    - Serbian (Latin, Serbia)\n+    - Slovak (Slovakia)\n+    - Slovenian (Slovenia)\n+    - Spanish (Spain)\n+    - Swedish (Sweden)\n+    - Thai (Thailand)\n+    - Turkish (Türkiye)\n+    - Ukrainian (Ukraine)\n+\n+1. Customize the elements on the **Layout**, **Styling**, and **Custom text** tabs.\n+\n+1. On the **Review** tab, select **Add** to add the language.\n+\n+## Related content\n+\n+- [Configure your company branding](../../fundamentals/how-to-customize-branding.md)"
  },
  {
    "sha": "e23dd010bd260e7a292685e201092ee745c16ea2",
    "filename": "docs/external-id/customers/media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/add-application-to-theme.png",

]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response: The changes introduce a new document, `how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md`, which details how to create and apply distinct branding themes to individual applications within an external Microsoft Entra tenant. This allows for unique sign-in experiences per application, overriding the default tenant-wide branding. The existing `how-to-customize-branding-customers.md` document has been updated to link to this new resource, and the table of contents (`toc.yml`) has been modified to include the new document under the "Customize branding" section for external identities.

changes.author: v-ccolin
changes.message:
Merge pull request #9734 from rolyon/rolyon-external-id-branding-theme-application

[Entra External ID] Customize your app with branding themes

F\n \n ## Related content\n \n-In this article we learned how to customize the look and feel of the customer sign-in and sign-up experience. To learn more about customizing the language of the tenant, see the [Language customization](how-to-customize-languages-customers.md) article.\n-For an understanding of the differences in workforce tenant branding, see the article [How to customize branding for your workforce](~/fundamentals/how-to-customize-branding.md).\n+- To learn more about customizing the language of the tenant, see [Language customization](how-to-customize-languages-customers.md).\n+- For an understanding of the differences in workforce tenant branding, see the [How to customize branding for your workforce](~/fundamentals/how-to-customize-branding.md).\n+- For information about how create unique authentication experiences for applications in your tenant, see [Customize the sign-in experience for your application with branding themes in external tenants](how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "3c2d0898fcad6af9b8c8e74886d77e4276f5f85b",
    "filename": "docs/external-id/customers/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md",
    "status": "added",
    "additions": 237,
    "deletions": 0,
    "changes": 237,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/9671a3c15f3f3345bba943778159ce9e756af06a/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/9671a3c15f3f3345bba943778159ce9e756af06a/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md?ref=9671a3c15f3f3345bba943778159ce9e756af06a",
    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,237 @@\n+---\n+title: Customize the sign-in experience for your application with branding themes in external tenants (Preview)\n+description: Learn about how to create branding themes and apply them to the sign-in experience for your application in Microsoft External ID for external tenants.\n+author: rolyon\n+manager: pmwongera\n+ms.author: rolyon\n+ms.date: 10/30/2025\n+ms.reviewer: \n+ms.service: identity-platform\n+ms.topic: how-to\n+#Customer intent: As a developer integrating with Microsoft Entra ID, I want to customize the sign-in experience for my application.\n+\n+---\n+\n+# Customize the sign-in experience for your application with branding themes in external tenants (Preview)\n+\n+[!INCLUDE [applies-to-external-only](../includes/applies-to-external-only.md)]\n+\n+> [!IMPORTANT]\n+> Branding themes for applications are currently in PREVIEW.\n+> This information relates to a prerelease product that might be substantially modified before it's released. Microsoft makes no warranties, expressed or implied, with respect to the information provided here.\n+\n+You can create unique authentication experiences for applications in your tenant. Each application can have its own theme that you can customize with a background image or color, favicon, layout, header, and footer. This customization overrides any configurations made to the default branding. If you don't make any changes to the elements, the default elements are displayed.\n+\n+This article describes how you can create multiple branding themes for different applications in your tenant.\n+\n+## Prerequisites\n+\n+- Have at least the [Organizational Branding Administrator](../../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#organizational-branding-administrator) role.\n+- Have at least the [Application Administrator](../../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#application-administrator) role for applications that you want to apply a theme to.\n+- A registered application in your tenant. If you haven't registered an application yet, see [Register an application](../../identity-platform/quickstart-register-app.md).\n+- Review the file size requirements for each image you want to add. Use a photo editor if needed to create correctly sized and formatted images: PNG, JPG, or JPEG with image size 245x36px and maximum file size 10KB.\n+\n+## Branding theme properties\n+\n+When you create a branding theme, here are some of the properties you can customize.\n+\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/sign-in-page-map.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the sign-in page, with each of the default branding elements highlighted.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/sign-in-page-map.png\":::\n+\n+| Property | Description |\n+| --- | --- |\n+| Favicon | Small icon that appears on the left side of the browser tab. |\n+| Header | Space across the top of the sign-in page, behind the header log. |\n+| Header logo | Logo that appears in the upper-left corner of the sign-in page. |\n+| Background image | The entire space behind the sign-in box. |\n+| Page background color | The entire space behind the sign-in box. |\n+| Banner logo | Logo that appears at the top of the sign-in box |\n+| Sign-in page title | Larger text that appears below the banner logo. |\n+| Sign-in page description | Text to describe the sign-in page. |\n+| Username hint and text | The text that appears before a user enters their information. |\n+| Sign-in display message box | Text you can add below the username field. |\n+| Footer link: Privacy & Cookies | Link you can add to the lower-right corner for privacy information. |\n+| Footer: Terms of Use | Text in the lower-right corner of the page where you can add Terms of use information. |\n+| Footer | Space across the bottom of the page for privacy and Terms of Use information. |\n+| Template | The layout of the page and sign-in boxes. |\n+\n+## How branding themes work\n+\n+Branding themes build on neutral branding and default branding.\n+\n+- **Branding theme** - Customizations of the default branding where you can have multiple themes.\n+- **Default branding (company branding)** - Customizations of the neutral branding for a tenant.\n+- **Neutral branding** - Initial branding for a tenant.\n+\n+Here are some important things to know about how branding themes work.\n+\n+- Branding themes can be applied to specific applications, while default branding applies tenant-wide.\n+- Default branding is used as fallback for any properties not defined in the branding theme.\n+- Neutral branding is used for any properties not defined in default branding.\n+\n+## Limits and constraints\n+\n+Here are some of the limits and constraints for branding themes.\n+\n+- You can create up to 5 branding themes per tenant.\n+- The live preview capability previews style and layout changes and only shows the Sign in page. Live preview doesn't include any custom text overrides.\n+- You can't use the name **Default theme** for your branding theme name. This name is reserved.\n+- Custom text changes are currently limited to sign-in page only.\n+- If you don't update the banner logo property, the Microsoft logo is displayed instead of the tenant name (neutral branding).\n+\n+## Create a new theme\n+\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com/) as [Organizational Branding Administrator](../../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#organizational-branding-administrator) and [Application Administrator](../../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#application-administrator).\n+\n+1. Browse to **Entra ID** > **Custom branding**.\n+\n+1. On the **Company branding** page, select **Branding themes** and then select the **Themes** tab.\n+   \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/create-new-theme.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Company Branding page and the Themes tab.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/create-new-theme.png\":::\n+\n+1. Select **Create new theme**.\n+   \n+1. On the **Basics** tab, enter a **Name** for your theme.\n+\n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/add-application-to-theme.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Create a theme page and the Basics tab to apply themes to applications.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/add-application-to-theme.png\":::\n+\n+1. To select the applications that will use this theme, under **Apply theme to**, select **Add applications**. (Or you can [add applications later](#apply-a-theme-to-applications).)\n+\n+1. On the **Layout** tab, select the placement of web page elements on the sign-in page.\n+\n+   - **Layout template** – Choose whether the sign-in pane is centre-aligned on the page or right-aligned.\n+   - **Header** – To show an image in a page header, select the checkbox and browse for the image you want to display. Requirements: Transparent PNG, JPG, or JPEG with image size 245x36px and maximum file size 10KB.\n+   - **Footer** – To show a page footer that includes links to your published privacy and cookies and/or terms of use statements, select the appropriate checkbox, enter the link text, and add the URL for your content.\n+     \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/layout-tab.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Create a theme page and the Layout tab to specify the sign-in experience.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/layout-tab.png\":::\n+\n+1. Select the **Preview** button to see your changes to the layout.\n+   \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/preview-button.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Preview button to preview a layout.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/preview-button.png\":::\n+\n+1. On the **Styling** tab, modify any of the background elements.\n+\n+   - **Background color** – The color that replaces the background image whenever the image can't be loaded, for example due to connection latency.\n+   - **Background image** – The large image that displays on the sign-in page. If you upload an image, it scales and crops to fill the browser window.\n+   - **Favicon** – The icon that displays in the web browser tab.\n+   - **Banner logo** – Displays on the sign-in page and in the user's access panel.\n+   - **Square logo (light theme)** – Represents user accounts in your tenant.\n+   - **Square logo (dark theme)** – If the light theme square logo displays poorly on dark backgrounds, you can upload a logo to be used in its place when dark backgrounds are used.\n+   - **Custom CSS** – Upload your own CSS file to replace default Microsoft styling with your own styling for: color, font, text size, position of elements, and displays for different devices and screen sizes. For more information, see [CSS template reference guide](../../fundamentals/reference-company-branding-css-template.md).\n+     \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/styling-tab.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Create a theme page and the Styling tab settings.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/styling-tab.png\":::\n+\n+1. Select the **Preview** button to see your styling changes.\n+   \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/sign-in.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the customized Sign in experience.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/sign-in.png\":::\n+\n+1. On the **Custom text** tab, for the **Sign-in** page, select the **Default** link.\n+\n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/custom-text-tab.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Create a theme page and the Custom text tab settings.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/custom-text-tab.png\":::\n+\n+1. Customize the text for the selected page and then select **Add**.\n+\n+    Custom text set for a theme might impact localized UX as they will not be localized. To ensure full localization of all text, set custom text for each theme language.\n+  \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/custom-text-edit.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Edit custom text page for the Sign-in page.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/custom-text-edit.png\":::\n+\n+1. On the **Review** tab, review your settings.\n+\n+1. Select **Create** to create the theme.\n+\n+## Apply a theme to applications\n+\n+In this section, you apply a theme to applications in your tenant.\n+\n+1. On the **Branding Themes** page, select the **Themes** tab.\n+\n+1. Select a theme you created to open the overview.\n+\n+1. Under **Basics**, select the pencil edit icon.\n+  \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/edit-theme-overview.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Overview tab of the edit theme page.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/edit-theme-overview.png\":::\n+\n+1. Under **Apply theme to**, select **Edit** to edit the list of applications.\n+  \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/edit-basics.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Edit Basics page to edit the list of applications.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/edit-basics.png\":::\n+\n+1. Search for or browse to your application. Select the check box, and then choose **Select**.\n+   \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/select-application.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Add applications page to select applications.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/select-application.png\":::\n+\n+## Edit a theme\n+\n+In this section, you edit a theme.\n+\n+1. On the **Branding Themes** page, select the **Themes** tab.\n+\n+1. Select a theme you created to open the overview.\n+\n+1. Select the pencil edit icon of the parts you want to edit.\n+\n+## Add a language to a theme\n+\n+In this section, you add a language to a theme.\n+\n+1. On the **Branding Themes** page, select the **Themes** tab.\n+\n+1. Select a theme you created to open the overview.\n+\n+1. On the **Languages** tab, select **Add a language** to customize the language of the theme.\n+\n+    The steps for customizing the language are similar to customizing branding theme.\n+  \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/languages-tab.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Languages tab to add a language.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/languages-tab.png\":::\n+\n+1. On the **Basics** tab, select a language.\n+  \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/language-basics-tab.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Add a language page and Basics tab to select a language.\" lightbox=\"./media/how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps/language-basics-tab.png\":::\n+\n+    The following languages are supported:\n+    \n+    - Arabic (Saudi Arabia)\n+    - Basque (Basque)\n+    - Bulgarian (Bulgaria)\n+    - Catalan (Catalan)\n+    - Chinese (China)\n+    - Chinese (Hong Kong SAR)\n+    - Croatian (Croatia)\n+    - Czech (Czechia)\n+    - Danish (Denmark)\n+    - Dutch (Netherlands)\n+    - English (United States)\n+    - Estonian (Estonia)\n+    - Finnish (Finland)\n+    - French (France)\n+    - Galician (Galician)\n+    - German (Germany)\n+    - Greek (Greece)\n+    - Hebrew (Israel)\n+    - Hungarian (Hungary)\n+    - Italian (Italy)\n+    - Japanese (Japan)\n+    - Kazakh (Kazakhstan)\n+    - Korean (Korea)\n+    - Latvian (Latvia)\n+    - Lithuanian (Lithuania)\n+    - Norwegian Bokmål (Norway)\n+    - Polish (Poland)\n+    - Portuguese (Brazil)\n+    - Portuguese (Portugal)\n+    - Romanian (Romania)\n+    - Russian (Russia)\n+    - Serbian (Latin, Serbia)\n+    - Slovak (Slovakia)\n+    - Slovenian (Slovenia)\n+    - Spanish (Spain)\n+    - Swedish (Sweden)\n+    - Thai (Thailand)\n+    - Turkish (Türkiye)\n+    - Ukrainian (Ukraine)\n+\n+1. Customize the elements on the **Layout**, **Styling**, and **Custom text** tabs.\n+\n+1. On the **Review** tab, select **Add** to add the language.\n+\n+## Related content\n+\n+- [Configure your company branding](../../fundamentals/how-to-customize-branding.md)"
  },

]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response:
A new document, `how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md`, has been added, detailing how to create and apply custom branding themes to individual applications within Microsoft External ID for external tenants. This new article introduces the concept of branding themes as a way to provide unique sign-in experiences for different applications, complementing the existing tenant-wide default branding.

The `how-to-customize-branding-customers.md` file has been updated to include a link to this new article in its "Related content" section. Additionally, the `toc.yml` file for the `external-id/customers` directory has been modified to include the new "Branding themes" section and link to the `how-to-customize-branding-themes-apps.md` article. Several image files related to the new branding themes documentation have also been added.
